검색

Prevention Policy
on Gender Violence

        In the 1990s, anti-gender violence groups have publicized women’s violence, which has been concealed as a private matter as a social issue. As a result, the Korean government enacted the 「 Act on Punishment of Sexual Crimes and Protection of Victims thereof 」 in 1994 to enact laws to punish and protect victims of sexual violence, domestic violence and prostitution. Moreover, the government has been promoting policies to prevent gender violence such as establishment of protection and support system for survivors and giving out gender violence prevention education.

        Related Laws and Action Plans

        2021s

        1. 1994

          「 Act on the Punishment of Sexual Crimes and Protection of Victims Thereof 」 (Abolished in 2011)

        2. 1997

          「 Act on Special Cases Concerning the Punishment, Etc. of Crimes of Domestic Violence 」

        3. 1997

          「 Act on the Prevention of Domestic Violence and Protection, Etc. of Victims 」

          「 Act on the Protection of Juveniles Against Sex Offenses 」

        2. 2002

          Announcement on the Comprehensive Action Plan on Eradicating Domestic and Sexual Violence

        3. 2004

          Announcement of the Comprehensive Action Plan to Prevent Prostitution

          「 Act on The Punishment of Arrangement of Commercial Sex Acts. Etc. 」

        2. 2010

        3. 2010

        Gender Violence Policy

        PREVENTION

        • Conduct Preventive Education on Prostitution · Sexual Assault · Domestic Violence in Public Institutions
        • Conduct “Violence Prevention Education Visits” on General Public
        • Conduct “Human Rights of Gender and Sexuality” education for children and adolescents which integrates sexual education and violence prevention education
        • Established Professional Agency for Child and Adolescent Sexual Education to foster healthy gender values for them

        PROTECTION·SUPPORT

        • Operate 24-hour report and counseling Hot-Line
        • Provide survivors’ accommodation and care facilities
        • Provide survivors’ medical support
        • Assist survivor’s recovery
        • Provide free legal assistance for survivors (consultation and rescue)
        • Foster self-support for survivors such as providing job training and etc

        INVESTIGATION·PUNISHMENT

        • Support survivors with public defenders
        • Foster and support statement-aid assistants dedicated for sexual violence survivor
        • Appoint judges, prosecutor, and police officers exclusively dedicated to dealing with sexual violence
        • Institutionalize the early response system for domestic violence such as temporary measures, restraining order and on-spot investigation
        • Disclose and Inform the personal information of a sex offender
        • Operate anti-recidivism education on sexual offenders

        Korean Women’s Development Institute publicized gender violence issues and established comprehensive measures at the government level and systemized survivor support services. Moreover, we also proposed an operating system for prevention and recidivism of gender violence. In addition, we also prepared countermeasures against various gender violence issues such as stalking, dating violence.
